page.title: 01LLANGURIG, MONTGOMERY, POWYS
page.content: Llangurig is situated in the south-east corner of the block which consists generally of hills covered mainly with improved grassland, due to {extensive draining and re-seeding {programmes. The village is placed in the{centre {of Wales}in the upper reaches of the {Wye Valley,}at a point where the{A470 joins the{A44}to{Aberystwyth.}It is said to be the{highest village in {Wales}(about 270m above sea-level). It could be a good area for walkers, but it is badly served with footpaths. The area has a{high rainfall}and a short summer season. The river{fishing}is poor, but the village is in easy reach of three good{reservoirs}-{Clywedog, {Elan Valley}and{Nantymoch. Some{Welsh}is spoken by older people,but{English}is the everyday language.
